result.execSummary:
The defendant Dmonte D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession With Intent To Deliver Controlled Substance-Cocaine (>5-15 Grams), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession With Intent To Deliver Controlled Substance-Heroin (3 Grams Or Less)

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 3 years.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other case.

superMiscConds.notes: Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.
Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Possession With  Intent To Deliver Controlled Substance-Cocaine (>5-15 Grams)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dmonte D Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dmonte D Williams in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Dmonte D Williams in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Count 1 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 10 YEARS, concurrent to any other case, credit for 170 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 5 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Mental health assessment, comply with any treatment
- Not to reside or be present where illegal drugs are present in any building and or vehicle.

- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER 3 YEARS. 
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Dmonte D Williams not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests plea and sentencing date. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Dmonte D Williams not in court, in custody.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 04 is down. Case rescheduled in Branch 04.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Dmonte D Williams not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dmonte D Williams in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Dmonte D Williams in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Detective S. Schmidt. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Dmonte D Williams in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Dmonte D Williams in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dmonte D Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
